issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Reply for undefined metadata entry contains stack trace

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Unknown meta-data request should return 404 only

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Stack Trace Returned When Trying to Access IAM directory Through Metadata service from Instance Launched without an Instance Profile

status.description: This issue is undergoing QA.  See linked QA issue(s) for progress.
status.name: In QA

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Hi All, Trying to run a meta-data request inside the instance like this {code} $ curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/metadata/ {code} This is what was returned {code} 404 - Not Found

404 - Not Found: failed to find metadata/

com.eucalyptus.context.ServiceDispatchException: Failed to send message String to service VmMetadata because: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{VmMetadata.component}. Message payload is of type: String

{code} The URL was in-correct , I typed metadata instead of meta-data but didn't expect the JAVA trace. If I do this on EC2 this is what I get: {code} $ curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/metadata 404 - Not Found

404 - Not Found

{code} Maybe we should improve our error messaging by not dumping the JAVA stack trace? If you have any questions, I am happy to provide inputs Cheers! Deependra
fields.summary: better error messaging for incorrect metadata URL

comments.body: Yay! (I was just about to file a dup of this. :-)

tested on 4.2.2 {noformat} $ curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/metadata/ 404 - Not Found

404 - Not Found

{noformat}

I would argue that something like this should even be in the CLC Error logs in the first place.  I just ran a while loop on an instance that does a curl to the non-existant URL and essentially just did a DDOS on my CLC logs.  It is adding about 20 entries per second making it next to impossible to troubleshoot any actual errors.

Please consider an alternative to just simply removing the Java stack trace.  We have several users apparently hitting the wrong URL and it will take a really long time to track down who is doing what.It would be nice to know which instance is making the bad call; this would be the information that should really be in the logs.

Oh and I'm running 4.2.1 but am only seeing the INFO entry in cloud-output.log.  I am not seeing any java stack trace.
